review_body: The hotel was very comfortable, the room is quite roomy, and the service was top notch. Location wise was very good, easy access to Shibuya station, also very convenience for us when we using baby stroller to go around. The staffs were very helpful. Definitely recommended to our friends.

We loved staying at the Cerulean Tower Tokyo Hotel!!We had visited the building before, for the Bellovista Bar, but not stayed here. However, when a different part of our trip was cancelled at the last minute, the hotel had a room available so we thought we’d try them out.The hotel and its staff are second to none! It’s definitely one of the loveliest places to stay in Tokyo! Our room was large by Japanese standards, with an opulent bathroom and all the amenities one could possibly want. We stayed on the 33rd floor, and the view across Tokyo was wonderful, a real treat! I can’t put into words how friendly and polite all the hotel staff are. They really go above and beyond.The location of this hotel is also great, particularly if you’re in Tokyo for 4 or 5 nights. It’s adjacent to Shibuya Station, which is a perfect departure point to get anywhere in Tokyo and beyond.My only small niggle is that they make you pay for access to the pool and gym. This seems out of place for a luxury hotel, particularly one where everything else is included. But that’s really it in terms of things they could improve.We will be back!

I loved being here. Its right above a 7/11 to get snacks or cash. It has amazing breakfast and the staff helped me make a bunch of reservations in Japanese so that I could go to more exclusive restaurants. Super clean rooms and bath products that smell amazing.

Hotel has a good location: close to the subway station Shibuya and also to the railway station Shibuya (Yamanote line) - just 5 min on foot.About 30 min by taxi from Haneda airport, but this ride will cost you about 80-90 USD. But there’s a cheap bus service to Haneda (1030 yen) / Narita airport (3100 yen) right next to the hotel.At check-in no deposit was held, just card details were added on file. Final payment was made upon check out.My neighbors next door were party guys, I could hear them in the hall, but not in my room, so I could relax and enjoy the silence.The room was quite small but there’s a small storage room for the luggage, that’s very comfortable.There’s an air cleaner in the room. Hotel offers an interesting ladies kit consists of cleansing gel, washing essence, lotion and cream - all of them were high quality products and really good on skin. All amenities are fully refreshed every day: even if I used just a half bottle of shampoo, I’ll additionally get a new one.Ventilation system is poor in the shower. You need to close bathroom door before taking a shower to avoid fire alert.However mirror is heated in the middle, so it’s not steamed up in the middle even after a long hot shower.There’s a nice typical Japanese toilet with a control panel (seat heating, bidet, shower).It was disappointing that I didn’t find any hook in the bathroom to hang on my wet towel or a bathrobe. The only shelf there is for dry towels, the bathroom itself is very small. Towels soak up the water really good and are very soft.Quality of sleep was perfect: soft blanket, comfortable mattress and choice of pillows - we took memory foam pillows.Room service food was average and quite expensive, but you can order it 24/7. You can find better and cheaper options outside.Tea (300 yen) and coffee (400 yen) in the room for extra cost. Gym and swimming pool access are also for extra cost.Hotel staff is great and very helpful. Concierge answered all my questions (I had plenty) and booked tickets to the flowers park in advance.I really enjoyed my stay and hope to come back.

We booked this hotel based on its location steps away from the famed Shibuya pedestrian crossing for the last night of our trip to Japan......such a pity.......This hotel can be easily accessed by public transportation, in this case we took the JR train to get to it and the hotel is literally right across the street.We were very positively surprised from the moment we set foot into the lobby area, the hotel is truly delightful with a calming ambiance in the midst of such a busy area of Tokyo. Check-in is fast and efficient, lifts will take you really quick to your room. We booked an Executiv room which we were really glad we did. It was fairly large in size with a very comfortable bed, a desk for working and a very nicely appointed bathroom with branded amenities. Executive rooms will grant you access to their Executive lounge which is a nice oasis to relax after a day of walking around the area. Typical hotel exec club amenities can be found here.Tokyo is a very big city so if you are going to be staying mostly in that part of town, I would not hesitate to book this property, you'll be happy you did. Expect a perfectly balanced mix of Japanese efficiency and hospitality with a Western hotel experience.

My stay at the Cerulean Tower must be one of my favourite ever stays. Upon checkin, as a Expedia Gold VIP member I was given a room upgrade to a corner room on a high floor. It was beautiful - think “Lost in Translation” looking out over Tokyo beautiful. From the window you could see the Shibuya crossing Starbucks but you’re so high up that you don’t get the noise. You could also see Mount Fuji! The service throughout the hotel was exemplary, from the check in staff to being shown around the room, and those working in the restaurant, bars and spa.I would suggest to the hotel that breakfast and spa access should be included, though I would also gratefully note that my room upgrade came with spa access. The swimming pool and jacuzzi is beautiful and very quiet.The breakfast room is very well featured and has incredibly attentive staff (a fantastic first experience of Japanese hospitality) though at 3000¥ per person/day you may wish to get your own elsewhere or go for an inclusive package.I can’t imagine staying anywhere else in Tokyo now - thank you Cerulean Tower Tokyu!

Perfectly nice hotel with good views and efficeint staff. Hard to feel like you are more than just a room number in these massive corporate hotels which I suspect caters to the business traveller more than domestic travellers. We did not use any of the facitilies in the hotels (restaurants, swimming pool, spa, bars, etc) as we had a full itinerary throughout our 3 night stay, but we found this hotel easy to get to (it's height an distinctive building shape makes it easy to identify when getting off at Shibuya station). 7-11 conveneince store at the bottom of the entrance - very handy!!! Slept well here and the beds were very comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great check-in and check-out, highly recommended.

We recently stayed here on a work/fun trip to Tokyo.Staff are friendly, helpful and efficient.Rooms are fabulous with comfy beds and great facilities, fabulous views over Tokyo too.Buffet breakfast was great with plenty of options.Health centre has a pool and gym equipment.Bar on Level 40 is great for a cocktail at the end of the day.Best bit about this hotel is that you can walk to so many local restaurants, sights, train stations etc.A fabulous location right near the Shibuya Crossing.Great stay...

We stayed at the Cerulean for 4 nights in January and we couldn't fault it! Our room was spacious, modern and elegant and the view of Shibuya from our window was amazing. The hotel itself is beautiful and all the staff are so friendly, respectful and extremely helpful. They have a guest services desk with an English speaking attendant to help you out with any enquires (like where to buy Disney Sea tickets etc.) but most check in staff could speak English well also. My partner proposed to me in our room at the Cerulean so it will always hold a special memory for us ❤We were so sad to leave on our last day!

Great location, helpful staff, nice decor. Not child friendly. Kids not allowed in the pool and weren’t allowed to come up to the bar with us so we could have a drink. Basically felt forced to our room. Tokyo in general is more difficult with young children. Not that the people weren’t friendly towards young children.

We have were in Curelean Tower Tokyo Hotel for our meeting recently. This hotel is situated just five minutes walk from the famous Shibuya Crossing of Tokyo It is also equal distance from Shibuya First Street, where many local food stores are located. This hotel is just one bus stop from Narita Airport. You can purchase a ticket inside the Arrival Hall for 3500 yen and take the bust outside at berth 10. In one hour and ten minutes you will be right outside this hotel. Going from hotel to airport is again one stop from the hotel lower lobby. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room is spacious and big.

Very conveniently located, in walking distance to Shibuya station and there are plenty of restaurants/convenient stores in the area so everything is within easy access. Staff were all very friendly and welcoming, rooms were pretty spacjous for Japan, very clean and had amazing views of the city. Airport limousine to both Haneda airport and Narita airport is also very convenient and comfortable.

We stayed on the 23rd floor of this tower and had a lovely view of Tokyo Tower. The hotel is lovely. Very helpful staff, great food, and extremely well-apportioned room. The property is extremely convenient to Shibuya crossing and Shibuya Station, and is in close proximity to great dining and shopping options.

We stayed here on the last night of our Japan trip and it was fantastic! The hotel is conveniently located near Shibuya station, but it was a little tricky to find our way there due to the construction going on near the station. Our experience with the staff was very pleasant, everyone was friendly and welcoming and could speak English well. There is also a direct bus at the basement to Haneda airport which was an added bonus, it saved us the hassle of lugging our luggage to the train station.

Stayed at this hotel because it was at Shibuya which was really fun for my family with two adult sons. Just a short walk to the famous crossings, shops, restaurants, subway and train stations. The staffs were always courteous and rooms are clean and comfortable. The concierge helped us with restaurant reservations via email weeks before we arrived. They would need your credit card to reserve; some busy restaurants would charge you for no show or late cancellation. Booked and prepaid this hotel early via Expedia with no trouble; got almost 20% discount, :-). Would go back to this hotel again.

Located just a short 5 to 10 minute walk to Shibuya station. Friendly staff. Nice quiet rooms. View was not the greatest. Plenty of restaurants and convenient stores nearby. The airport limo bus does drop you off directly at the hotel. Only complaint I had was that the housekeeping came at inconsistent times. There was a couple of days where we got back to our room expecting for the room to be done, but it wasn't. Other than that small issue, we enjoyed out 6 night stay with this hotel.

We took an airport limo from Narita airport straight to this hotel (approx 1.5hrs). Staff were very friendly & service was excellent. Shortly after checking in we walked 5mins to the famous Shibuya crossing. Main streets were lively with so many people on a Friday night and Main Street full of food choices. We even found the beautiful statue of Hachi. The hotel is so close to all this which was why we chose it. Great hotel, clean rooms with amenities. City view was amazing. Concierge was a great help with advising on transport to Yokohama Port by train (about 40mins) to start our cruise the next day.

This is a very large, modern hotel with very good facilities. The rooms are large, clean and modern.The hotel is in a great location about 5/10 minutes walk from the main centre of Shibuya with all the entertainment, food and drink and shopping.

We had arranged a 3 day stay over the busy New Year period to meet our son travelling up from Australia. The hotel kindly put us in adjoining rooms. We paid extra for the executive floor which proved wonderful. It gives you access to the lounge on floor 35 where you can have a lovely buffet style breakfast ( smoked salmon included) looking out with marvellous views of the city and Mount Fuji. The breakfast was included in the price and along with afternoon tea and nibbles also included unlimited alcoholic drinks which included Tattinger Champagne, wine, bottled bear , spirits etc between 5.30 & & 7.30. The room itself was clean, large ( we had a queen room) with all modern fitments , gadgets and of course the heated toilet seat ! The hotel itself is situated about a 5 minute walk from Shibuya station which has marvellous links to and from airport and the Tokyo train network. Being in Shibuya the access to shops was excellent. Plenty of restaurants and eating places nearby but not too many of the higher quality. We ate in the French Restaurant in the Hotel one night which was very nice, but also very expensive.We had a great time there, and the staff go out of their way to be very polite and helpful. Overall thoroughly recommended

always a perfect stay at this hotel. i have been here many times and it never fails me. the service is great (mr kurihara at concierge has solutions for everything), the location is perfect, and the price is on target for what you get. highly recommended

Stayed for two nights. The location is right by the Shibuya station. We've been to Tokyo many times in the past, but this is the first time we stayed in this neighborhood. We wanted hang out in Ebisu, Nakameguro and Daikanyama areas, and this hotel was reasonably close. Also we had dined at the French restaurant on the top floor a few years ago, and found it to be very good.I wouldn't call it a solid 5-star, more close to being a solid 4-star. Rooms are somewhat tired. The b-fast buffet is limited. The restaurants are solid (the Sichuan place is pretty good), but it's like that in most hotels in Tokyo.Not much to do in the Cerulean Tower complex - dining options are fairly limited, nothing really compelling about the whole complex. Don't expect Roppongi Hills or Tokyo Midtown, or even Tokyo Garden Terrace. It's just a big building in Shibuya.But Coucagno (French) has a lovely view of the city with great food, and the Sichuan is nice change of pace if you're staying in the city for more than a few days.

A great hotel in a good location a few mins walk away from Shibuya train station. Super friendly staff, really comfy beds and a superb shower. It had a good breakfast buffet with a a good selection Highly recommended.

It’s ok. Nothing special about this hotel. Staff maybe too used to tourists that they are.not up to par with the st Regis or capital hotel guests service It is very close to Shibuya crossing. We stayed four nights here then checked out to go to osan then come back the next night.

Stayed here for a business trip. Staff was amazing, the rooms were nice sized and very clean. There are a few shops around the hotel. Great location and great hotel. I would stay here again when in Tokyo.

The Cerulean Tokyu Hotel in Shibuya was excellent and we had always wanted to see the scramble crossing where all the pedestrains cross at the same time and this was an excellent location for this and close to the trains. The staff were so kind and we recomend this hotel to everyone as the room was great and the service second to none.

Such a comfortable room. Large room, large bathroom, all the amenities I could ever need and more with an amazing view to top it off.Super convenient to Shibuya Station and many things in the area. Very much enjoyed the bar also with a stellar view.

The Cerulean Hotel is conveniently located near the Shibuya train station. Upon entering the hotel, staff take our luggage and wiped down the wheels as it was sprinkling outside. The check-in process was seamless and quick.Our room was fabulous. The tub overlooked Shibuya and the water pressure is the shower was absolutely PERFECT. They provide every toiletry you can think of and the bed...it was SOOO comfortable. The room was spacious and included a little desk, coffee table and couch/chair. I would highly recommend this hotel if you like classy and luxurious properties. I would definitely stay here again.

I visited this hotel a few times in the past year while in Tokyo for business. Recently I asked to reschedule my trip because I could not leave Hong Kong due to the current political disruption. I was asking to switch the trip by 1 week to assure my kids safety. They refused and charged me a large deposit. They were totally inflexible and a but rude about it. It’s too bad because the hotel is quite nice and well located. However, do not book this hotel if you think you might ever have to reschedule your trip. They are not agile for their clients.

We had booked a superior room but were upgraded to a corner suite on the 34th floor when we arrived. It was a true luxury experience, with a great view over Tokyo (including Mt Fuji one day). We enjoyed our stay here at the start of our trip to Japan, and would stay again.

Really great hotel with amazing view both at daytime and by night. The staff was very helpful and they do speak english better than most places in Tokyo. We were 3 in a spacious room; the bathroom was nice. The internet speed okay. I recommend you try the afternoon tea and the stunning cakes in the lounge in the lobby.

We stayed here in late October with our toddler. The Japanese hospitality came through at every level, which is what made Cerulean one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in. Highly recommended!Pros:Great location - to trains as well as eateries and shopping, also first stop for airport bus to shibuyaSuper helpful and caring staff - they put in extra offer to make sure my toddler was taken caring ofSpacious rooms with awesome viewL’occitane amenities for those with picky skinCons:None and if you think of any the staff will probably make it right

This is the first time staying at this hotel. The rooms are big, the shower/tub was huge! Overall the stay was pleasant and just a short walk into Shibuya crossing and many other stores. This place is convenient since you can catch a limousine bus from Haneda Airport and it will stop at this hotel.

My wife and I stayed one night to watch Wales v Australia in rugby world cup, excellent game and excellent hotel.Ground floor restaurant good for breakfast, lunch, and late dinner after game with super service as well as good food. Even breakfast buffet was unusually comfortable with a good choice.Outstanding room for comfort, décor, and view.

the room is quite common and not very "fancy" I did not like the bathrom tub inside the shower cabin .....The room has a smell also you can find a greshner in the closet !I like the french restaurant on the roof top and I did not like the chineses restaurant ( food not that good)I was very statisfied with the staff and room service very efficient and fast !

Close to famous crossing and easily walkable from station.We had a great room overlooking the crossing and central Tokyo: the view at night was super.Room was high quality and spacious. Staff all speak really good English.40th floor bar worth a visit, not too dear. Ask staff for a window table but don’t help yourself! (They will move you there one one comes free).

I stayed here with a friend after mother fiend recommended it. It was the PERFECT hotel to stay on my first visit to Tokyo. Great location 7min walk from Shibuya station. The room was big, with a big bathroom and amazing water pressure ( I think that’s a thing in Japan). Very convenient as you can take the Narita Express straight from Narita to Shibuya Station. Would definitely stay here again and I totally recommend it.

My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Cerulean Tower and we enjoyed it very much. A map shows that the hotel is walking distance from Shibuya Station. However, it’s not as easy as it looks to find the hotel once you emerge from Shibuya Station. A nice person on the street took pity on us and helped us find the hotel. I recommend taking a cab to the hotel, even though it’s not far from the train station, because Shibuya Station is absolutely huge, and it’s no fun wandering around lost with luggage. We stayed in a room on an executive floor for access to the executive lounge for breakfast in the a.m. and a light dinner/hors d’oeuvres/drinks in the evening. The food in the executive lounge was good and the staff was polite. Our room was small but clean. The hotel pool is heated to a nice, warm temperature and the locker room was spotless. There is a very large shopping area nearby where we found, among other things, a great place for a foot/chair massage (Queensway Relaxation Station — we went there twice!). Overall, I recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Tokyo.

We recently had a 6 night stay at this hotel. We found the location very good, a short walk down the hill to Shibuya Station and the famous Scramble Crossing. Our room on level 28 was very clean, spacious, comfortable beds & with a really good sized bathroom compared to all the other hotels we stayed in in Japan. Hotel staff were all very attentive and most helpful when we needed information about trains etc. The bar on level 40, although a little pricey was very pleasant with great views of suburban Tokyo.The only negative for us was that, after long days out seeing all the sights, a swim in the pool would have been welcome, as the temperature each day was mid thirties but to have to pay for that privilege, we felt was not warranted for a luxury hotel. We have stayed at many hotels around the world and have NEVER before have had to pay extra to use pool and gym facilities. That said, we had a most enjoyable stay and would be happy to stay there again.

My wife left her purse in the room. Housekeeping sent it to us in Kyoto. $600 still in the wallet. That’s real customer service and the employee should be commended for their honesty. Beautiful hotel. Very close to everything.

My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights in this stunning hotel located in the center of Shibuya, one of the top neighbourhood to be in Tokyo. our room was on the 25th floor with free access to the lounge (which was amazing if you wanted to grab something to eat or drink and it was for free), we really enjoyed it! The room also was beautiful, super spacey and very well equipped with everything that we may have needed - and with a breathtaking view of Tokyo. The hotel is very elegant, also featuring a variety of nice restaurants, a bar at the top floor, a sauna, an amazing swimming pool, a gym, several shops and a number of further services. We really enjoyed our staying it was great! Also breakfast was very good. My reccomendation is to expressly request the free access to the lounge upon booking, it is a great experience indeed! Thank you.

The location is perfect. 5 minutes to Shibuya station either via South exit or via Mark City. From Shibuya one can reach many places like Shinjuku and Tokyo Station without changing train or metro.Staff was great. Prompt. Courteous.Upgraded to corner room almost like a suite! Late checkout allowed and timed perfectly with airport bus from basement one. Like all Japanese hotels gym access restricted to premium members otherwise have to pay a fee.Found two nice cafes near Shibuya station so I didn’t eat at hotel at all: Boulangerie Cafe opposite Shibuya Hikarie and Jean Francois on level 4 of Mark City.Recommended for repeat stays!

Our family stayed here for 6 nights. The location is great and the staff at the front were helpful. The room was a bit old but very well maintained. We love Shibuya and we would want to stay again if it wasn't for the service at the bar called BELLOVISTO on the 40th floor which we went on the last night. The view was great but the service was TERRIBLE. I can speak Japanese fluently so I can tell that the staff was using rude tones with me and asking for something we did not need. I asked if there was any tea or coffee because I cannot drink alcohol. He said there were none so I asked for a bottle of Evian and a green tea mocktail. We also ordered glasses of whisky as well, and I asked if we can have hot water. He said to me in a VERY rude way that we need to order for everyone(which we did) so I had to explained that we want the hot water in addition to what we ordered. We ordered one plate of nuts but he kept pushing us to order 2 plates because it might not be enough. I have never seen a pushy and rude staff like this before. We ordered 4 drinks and nuts and we paid 14,000 yen for the bad moments, not a pleasant experience at all. I just want other guests to be careful of the staff at this bar. They seem to care only for the Japanese customers and the service towards us foreigners was very bad.

wonderful service and views with a quick check in great views and k located close to Shibuya station ( Narita Express now stops here too)_its marvelous. With a restaurant by Iron Chef Chen Kenichi to top it off. On enegative instant coffeee.....

The location of this hotel is perfect. So close to the greatest shopping and hot spots. A stones throw away to the train station and eateries. The service at this hotel was so nice and gracious. Easy check in and check out and every time you walked in and out you were treated with great respect and wonderful smiles. The room - very clean and very spacious. Fantastic bed, so comfy and pillows make for a good nights sleep. It would be a 5 star review had the room not smelt of cigarettes. For a non smoking room the cigarette smell was hard to take. There is a humidifier in the room but it doesn’t take away the tobacco stench whatsoever. I would wake up every morning feeling I’d been in a smoky jazz bar. My only assumption is that the room/floor we were on was in its previous life a room where a lot of smoking had been done.

Stayed here part business, part pleasure in December 2018. Very efficient from start to finish. Kind, friendly staff throughout the hotel.Clean, corporate/style bedroom with plenty of room. Very close to Shibuya - easy walk and downhill!

A typical Japanese hotel. - very clean and everything works smoothly. Staff are very attentive. Good location, very close to Shibuya and Shibuya station. Prices are very reasonable for Tokyo, and the rooms surprisingly spacious. There is a musty/damp smell in the corridors and room (at least on 19th floor) - there is a air purifier in the room but it doesn’t seem to make much difference.

Cerulean is a great hotel with an awesome view of the city. Close to everything in Shibuya. We found it to be very clean with very helpful staff. The bar on the top level is a great place to have a drink. highly recommended

We thought we booked a 5 star hotel in lively Shibuya, instead we ended up in a bed bug infested, severely dated, dirty hotel. The first room smelled musty and like mildew. We were shown two more rooms, they all had the same awful mold smell. They offered to add an additional air purifier and deodorize the room but that's when we found that the last room was infested with bed bugs crawling behind the headboard. They refused to cancel the first night and said we'd incur the cost as a cancellation fee. Needless to say, we walked away and never looked back. You've been warned, do not stay here!

Extremely friendly and helpful staff. The concierge's are fantastic. Great location (just a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station).I recommend paying extra to have a room which includes the Executive Lounge. Breakfast is awesome, and happy hour is too.Rooms are very comfortable with great views.

I made a reserv for a family room which was supposedly 800+ sqft. When I arrived I was told it was basically 2 connecting rooms. I paid over $900 with tax per night to get 2 basic rooms. Yet the paper I had on my hand clearly said 1 suite and the pictures showed a large suite which was nothing like what we got. The pictures showed a living area and a big comfortable room. After I presented the front desk manager with proof of what I had reserved, He then tried to tell me I would have to pay more for the suite, ( i had booked) Had he told me that he didn't have the suite available, perhaps I would of understood. Yet instead of giving in, or simply going by the rule, customer is always right. He was asking for additional money. After a 30 hour trip from Miami to Tokyo, we were tired and had enough. I took the rooms he said we paid for, even though again, my reservation said something else. All he would do was say sorry, but he didn't do anything else to accommodate us. I'm still in Japan and will return to Tokyo in a few days. But rest assure we will never set foot in that hotel ever again. Anybody from my organization and anyone who ask me, I will be sure to tell them to stay away from bait and switch hotel.Side note,we decided to stay an additional night before moving on to Hiroshima, but we chose to move hotels to the Hilton.WHAT a difference in treatment and how they take care of their guest.It reminds me why sometimes it's better to stick to the big names we all know.

We stayed on the Executive floor, as a couple we enjoyed the perks, and the peace and quiet. The staff was excellent in every way. The perks included the use of the pool and gym, which was important to us, as well as the executive floor breakfast, tea and evening snacks. The floor plan and bathroom layout was very well thought out and made it easy for both of us to get ready at the same time. Laundry service was excellent and punctual. The location on the JR line is one stop away from Shinjuku Station, ( just a few minutes) which is where many tourists stay. We found it a bit more peaceful at Shibuya, and we often walked past Shibuyu crossing to sites. There are a few small Mom & Pop style restaurants behind Cerulean Tower, we did not try any, but it was good to note they were there. There is also a small convenience store on the property that sells all the little things that a traveler might need. The view was spectacular. If you have little kids, then the Executive Floor is not for you,...but if you wish to be with Adults only, and have the perks of gym, pool, and the service at the Executive Lounge then it's a good choice. Some of our local guides mentioned to us that they only hear great things about the Cerulean Tower, and that certainly rings true to us. First time hints;Pool and gym, very clean, pool must have swim cap or they will lend you one. Very clean well equipped showers at the pool area. Do not wear your robe to the gym,pool, must wear clothes and change there.Executive check in is beside the the regular check in, about 40 feet away, a completely different desk. Train from Haneda airport was about 30 minutes. Only a 5 minute or less walk from the station, very easy to to get to with luggage. If you need to avoid stairs always check for a elevator near the stairs which is usually just around the corner.

A nice new large hotel with views of the city from your room. The rooms are your average hotel room with nothing special. The staff are attentive. The facilities are average. Access to the gym is only between 6-7am. The restaurants are expensive

Great hotel for a solo business trip. I spent 6 nights here and really enjoyed myself. Lovely staff and the facilities are great. Good gym. Airport Limousine Bus stops here too. Would definitely stay again. Great location.

Spent three nights here with work colleagues. We booked 15 rooms and everyone seemed very satisfied. Consistently we agreed one of the best things about this place is the location. Walking distance to lots of restaurants,shops... Tokyo is a bit place but this area feels like the middle of it all. Rooms were very large for local standards, and the views from all rooms were very good. Breakfast was quite decent as well - overall would definitely return

The hotel is in a wonderful area in Shibuya. Check in was quick but don’t try to get an early check in - the staff will not help you. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed. Had fantastic views from our room of Tokyo. There is a small supermarket in the hotel which is convenient. The hotel is not cheap but it really is comfortable, well maintained ,staff helpful if you need anything. If you want to use the pool there is a surcharge and it is indoors. They offer a portable WiFi router for a small fee in the rooms that you can connect and take out with you , this is very handy and a nice touch.

I liked this hotel a lot, but the area not so much. Shibuya is very busy, compare it to Times Square NYC. The shopping was disappointing, too many of the same stores and brands I can find in the US. There was also a lot of construction around the hotel and you have to use inconvenient detours when construction is going on at night. As for the hotel, service and staff were great. They speak English (for the most part) and were very helpful. The room and bathroom were huge, similar to what I've stayed in in parts of Europe. The bed was comfortable, the views are spectacular at night. The hotel has everything you need, definitely check out the rooftop bar. My only complaint is the room smelled of old smoke even though it was classified as a non smoking room. I think this is common in older hotels in Japan. As nice as this hotel was, I would not stay in this area on my next visit.

This hotel is such a great hotel .The location is great in Shibuya 5 mins from the train station and the famous crossing.So easy and convenient to get around Tokyo.The rooms are immaculate , great size for Japan and very clean.The staff at this hotel are also amazing. Thanks to the staff in the executive lounge and also Kimi for making my stay a great one.If you are looking for a 5 star central hotel, look no further.

We've stayed here before, and this year we stayed again on two separate occasions, both times for two nights. What's to like? First, the location, for us, is good. Only a few minutes walk to Shibuya station. Getting around Tokyo is easy, although the Shibuya station area is currently under construction and walking can be disorienting with pedestrian traffic re-routed here and there. Shibuya area is also quite crowded. Nonetheless, this is a good location. First stop from the airport for the airport bus limousine service. Airport transfers are therefore very convenient. Second, the hotel itself is modern, up-to-date, and quite clean. Our rooms were on the 36th and 33rd floors. Rather large for Tokyo standards. Nice walk-in shower and lots of good amenities in the bathroom. Bed was a super king size. Very comfortable. Big screen TV with two or three English language news channels. Third, we liked the breakfast room and its service. The room is bright and cheerful, full of morning light. There's a lot of buffet choices. Fresh squeezed orange juice is a favourite. Last and certainly not least is the friendly and efficient general staff service. Check-in was a breeze. Hotel stored a large suitcase for us while we journeyed to Nikko for a few days. When we returned, the staff had already placed our suitcase in our new room. Concierge service was excellent. Very helpful arranging train tickets and airport transfers for us. Special thanks to Ms. Naoko Tsugita, Chief Concierge, for her excellent personal service. She even greeted us at the check-in desk on our return to ask how her train ticket arrangements for our Nikko trip worked out. We were also given personal assistance getting the limousine airport transfer by her associate concierge. And another thanks to Ms. Yuka, an English-speaking server in the cafe at dinner time. Thanks for your cheerful service. For all these reasons, the Cerulean is and will be our choice in Tokyo.

I stayed 2 nights here and it was an excellent place to start my time in Japan. Easy to get to from Narita (I took the airport limousine for ~$30 USD and it brings you directly to the lobby - booked at the airport without an issue). Check in was a breeze. I was offered a complimentary upgrade to a king size bed (YAY) and had a lovely view of Tokyo. The room is clean and quiet; but nothing special. When I booked this hotel, I got a sale rate. For that rate, it was fine. Without the sale rate, it isn’t worth it. Several bathroom amenities but notably no lotion or shower cap. Just an FYI. Also no coffee maker in the room - I think it was instant? I don’t drink coffee often but I don’t think I’ve been in a hotel in Asia that hasn’t provided a nespresso machine or something similar. Especially at this price point.The bed is comfortable; actually softer than I expected. A couple of different types of pillows. The blackout shades work like a charm and are necessary for the very early sunrise. The hotel is about a 3-4 min walk to the Shibuya train station, which is one of its huge benefits. This station has a JR office, for those of you starting your rail pass or the like. Service has been wonderful so far, though I certainly haven’t required much. The gym is free from 6-7am; after which you must pay. It opens at 6am and is quite busy bc it’s free. If you want to workout in peace - go after 7am. The gym is compact with the basics. There is a small stability ball and some stretch mats. No yoga mats or foam rolls. There is a stretch area as well. Breakfast is also a separate cost, which I didn’t opt for. There are a 7-11 and a Family Mart right around the hotel.Laundry service is prompt and good - but fairly expensive. WiFi was excellent - no problem with FaceTime or streaming shows.Never had a problem with any smoke smells in the room. I know this can be a common issue in Asia. They have a lovely pastry shop in the lobby; unfortunately I wasn’t able to partake. But if you have a sweet tooth, you’re in luck!Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend but I’m not sure that I would stay again for this price.

I lost some gifts in the airport bus from the hotel. I realized this when I was boarding the plane. After a lot of communication with the bus company and no help the hotel stepped in. They got my gifts back and sent them to me. So thankful!The staff i wonderful. We could not afford their breakfast so we bought breakfast in the supermarket. We had a winderful breakfast view.

Overall: Luxury hotel situated near Shibuya station with topnotch service.Location: Right in Shibuya. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the station. Remember though that once you get in the station, you may have to walk another 10 minutes - its big. If you are trying to catch the NRT airport express, I would leave at least 20 minutes ahead of time. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within an 10 minute walk. The famous Shibuya crossing is 5-10 minutes away - you can get a nice view from Starbucks or the L'Occitane Cafe.Service: Amazing. The gentleman at the front desk, Mr. Ishioka, was most gracious and helped us resolve a room issue (we were initially assigned a double twin room but wanted one with queen/king bed ). The front desk manager, Mr. Takahiro Tsuruga, was also fantastic. They also gave us helpful recommendations. There are plenty of staff in the lobby to help with whatever is needed. We had not wait for checkin or checkout. Room: Luxury. Large bathroom with L'Occitane products to keep you smelling nice. The shower is large and roomy. The room itself is large with great views. Of course, they have a fancy toilet. Nespresso machine in room! They also provide several bottles of water. The only negative on the room is that there are few outlets;however, at lest one or two outlets will accommodate a US three prong plug which is nice. Unfortunately, they do not have any dedicated USB outlets. Sleep: Large,comfortable bed. No noise. You control the temperature. The black out curtains are very effective.Food/Drink: We went to the 40th floor bar which had great views of Tokyo. Drinks are little on the pricey side, but hey, it is Tokyo. Let me repeat, the view is fantastic. We did not dine at the hotel. There is a convenience store in the hotel.Value: The hotel is above average in cost per night, but I think the value is high. It is great hotel. I think i is well worth the extra $50-60 per night when compared to more 'average' hotels. We did not want to leave.Would I stay here again? Absolutely. We stayed in May 2019.

My husband and I plus our two adult children and their significant others recently spent 5 nights at the Cerulean Tower in Shibuya. We struggled with staying in Shinjuku vs. Shibuya and feel we definitely made the right choice. In our view, Shibuya gives you the typical feel of Tokyo without some of the touristy or seediness you will find in certain parts of Shinjuku. The Cerulean offered comfortable rooms, a prime location just a 5 minute walk from Shibuya station (and the Shibuya crossing) and quick access to a multitude of great restaurants. We splurged and booked a room with Executive Floor access. Pricey, but worth it. Stunning views, afternoon tea and snacks, free cocktail hour and special check-in. An airport shuttle bus also stops at this hotel; for about $30 pp easy transport direct to the property after a long flight which was much appreciated.We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Lovely hotel with lovely rooms and stunning views across Tokyo. Excellent staff who are friendly and polite. I was very surprised I had to pay to use the swimming pool in the hotel Gym given the hotel rate but hey ho. The bed is super comfortable and the hotel location is perfect. I would very happily return to this hotel to stay.

Amazing hotel a short walk from Shibuya station. Our room had fantastic views over Tokyo, but the bar on the top floor had a spectacular outlook over the city and to Mount Fuji. A great place for a sunset drink. Our room was large with an enormous king sized bed. The hotel was very expensive but we loved it. There are lots of little cafes, restaurants and wine bars in the area.

Great hotel in a great position with superb room. Cleaning staff A1. I rated a 4 star because the breakfast is well below standard for such a hotel. Much lesser rated hotels provide a much better variety of food and quality. The staff at this hotel are amongst the best I have ever encountered. Great hotel great staff but poor breakfast.

Perfect location, view minutes walk from Shibuya crossing. We had corner room on 34th floor with amazing view of the city. The room was large with nice bathroom very well equipped. On 35th floor is executive lounge with nice European breakfast. `We used swimming pool - big enough for good swimming. The bar on the top floor is must visit - the view is great. Very nice professional staff.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my mother on a 2.5 week trip in Japan and it was absolutely perfect. Location:I saw another guest comment about how the location is awkward within Shibuya and I don’t understand this at all. The location is absolutely perfect as it is only a few steps away from Shibuya station and the infamous Shibuya crossing. There are elevators on the long walkway crossing from the train to the hotel also, so it’s luggage friendly without having to worry about steps. There is easy access to everywhere you want to go in Tokyo as you can access the JR pass lines from the train as well as all the local trains. You are also walking distance from night entertainment in Shibuya, Roppongi, etc. without feeling like you are in the heat of the madness. Rooms:The rooms are massive for Japan and we had a great view of the city. Beds were super comfortable, top class toiletries and bathroom was luxurious. There was a cute little seating area with a table next to the window and it truly felt like we could relax in a luxurious room after coming back from a tiring day running around Tokyo. They also had a pocket WiFi (kind of like a hotspot) you could bring with you around the city for a small fee if you wanted. Facilities/grounds:The hotel itself is huge, but somehow manages to not feel crowded and it maintains a personalized feel. Between the abundance of restaurants, attentive staff members, high ceilings and multiple entrances, it never feels like you’re drowning in the mass, which I found to be unique. There is also a 7/11 on the 2nd floor which came in handy for local snacks and beverages when we would come home at night. Although we didn’t have time to use it, there is also a pool on premise (next time!). Service:Service level was top notch, especially considering that we speak zero Japanese. Check-in was a delight, complete with our bags brought up and a full tour of our room despite not staying in an executive suite. The concierge somehow pulled off a last minute dinner reservation for us for a same-day omakase reservation with 4 hours notice. Upon check-out, we were able to store our (many) bags up front for a few hours while we searched for our last bowl of ramen. Overall, this was one of my favorite hotels on our trip and I would fully recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the Shibuya area. It was an absolute delight for us and I’m looking forward to staying here again next time I’m in Tokyo. Highly recommended!

This hotel has everything covered. From the seamless check in with personal guides to the area, to the handy print offs to guide you around Shibuya. The room is excellent, wonderfull bedding great views lovely bathroom. We were in a King on the 32nd floor. Worth paying for the higher floors! The bar was lovely and has the best views of Shibuya. Bit expensive though and we were initially given pretty rubbish seats as guests. They charge a cover charge for non guests so tried to keep those tables free bit cheeky. Apart from that service was exceptional. Great location the bridge crossing goes straight into the hotel.

Very disappointed to learn after check in that the pool (the specific reason we booked this hotel) is forbidden to under 18s, as is the main restaurant. Of course the photo of the pool is prominent on the website but the under -18 rule is way at the bottom where no-one looks. What a fraud.

For any guests with children- do not book this hotel.They do not allow anyone under 18 years old to use their pool facilities. Our child was very disappointed. The hotel was booked so we could relax with our daughter after a day of sightseeing etc. Otherwise, we would have never stayed here. As well, I noticed something else- if any guests has a tattoo of some sort, they are not allowed to use the fitness centre facilities. Seems a very discriminatory hotel. Overall disappointing.

Superb high end hotel with a breathtaking view from the bar. Very expensive, but what would you expect? One of the largest hotel rooms we have ever had with massive bathroom with large window. Also on site is a wonderful Chinese restaurant and one of the best breakfast buffets we had in the Orient.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights during our visit to Japan. From the moment we were greeted by the smartly uniformed lobby staff to the moment we left we were treated like royalty by all the staff members we encountered. We chose a room on the executive floor that was more of a suite than a room as it contained a super king size bed, a sofa, two chairs, two tables, a footstool and a large tv. It was immaculate as was the large bathroom with separate shower and bath area.Evening cocktails and canapés in the lounge were very good and Tattinger champagne was available at no additional cost.Our checkout time was 12noon but their was no issue in us using the executive lounge until our airport bus departure at 1.40pmExcellent location and great views from the room.Highly recommend this hotel and its staff.

The location of this hotel while in Shibuya is a little awkward. We also found it strange that we could not go to the top floor of the hotel to the restaurant because we had our daughter with us. Considering a cover charge and just wanting to have a drink while enjoying the view, it’s a bit frustrating considering the price of the hotel. We were also charged an additional $80AUD to have a roll away in the room for our daughter. Families don’t seem to be too well catered to

Amazing central location, short walk from Shibuya station and the scramble crossing. Room was huge, as was the bed. It was a supersized king and then some. Staff were lovely and helpful. There’s a 7 eleven on level 2 that kept us caffeinated everyday and had everything else you’d expect from a Japanese convenience store. Views from the bar on level 40 were nice as were the cocktails, but you’re better off heading to the New York bar for views and drinks with live jazz. I recommend this hotel whole heartedly.

The Cerulean Tower was a great choice for our first stop in Japan. The airport limo bus from Haneda stops right at the hotel, so it was an easy arrival when you're tired and jetlagged. It's a very nice, modern high rise hotel in a great location, a couple blocks from Shibuya Station which gives easy access to the Yamanote Line and lots of other train/subway options. There are lots of restaurants in the area, and a 7-11 onsite (outside on the plaza level) with an international ATM.We stayed on the executive floor, which gave us access to the lounge for breakfast (very convenient) and later in the day for refreshments. This was well worth it, and made it feel a bit smaller and more personal. We met some fellow travelers and exchanged helpful tips for sightseeing. Great view of Mt Fuji on a clear day, also.The room itself (a superior king) was a good size and comfortable, with plenty of charging ports bedside and on the desk. There was a walk-in closet with drawers, giving plenty of space to unpack. We had a beautiful city view, and a sofa to sit and enjoy it. The large marble bathroom had a retractable clothesline for drying hand laundry. The toilet is not in a separate enclosure, but it was otherwise very modern and well-appointed.Service was good. The concierge desk in the lobby was sometimes not staffed, but other employees were always eager to assist.

This hotel's location is extremely convenient visiting around in Tokyo although Shibuya is a very crowded area. Shibuya is a hub of public transportation, and it won't be that expensive if you want to use taxi to other famous areas such as Omotesando, Aoyama, Roppongi. I stay at the Executive Floor room which offers free breakfast, snacks, drinks & cocktails at Executive Lounge. The bathroom is very spacious which reminds me Japanese style bathtub. The room is big and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Amazing hotel, my wife and I spent 5 nights here and I can't say enough good things. Staff are all friendly and helpful with anything you need including restaurant reservations. The rooms all have beautiful views of the city (ask for a room with a high floor) and are extremely clean and spacious. Be sure to go up to the top floor first thing in the morning to try and catch a glimpse of Mt Fuji. The location is also perfect with just minutes away from Shibuya Subway. What's also nice is that you can get away form the hustle and bustle by walking towards Daikan-Yama and Naka-Meguro which are very cool neighborhoods with boutique shopping and trendy places to grab a bite to eat or have a drink.When we come back to Japan, this will be the hotel we stay at again without question!

The hotel located few minutes walking from the famous Shibuya Crossing and station. The rooms are very spacious and there is a killer view from the windows to the city.There is a great restaurant and bar on the 40’s floor.There is a gym and swimming pool that some of the facilities are free to use during the early morning hours.The service is excellent and the staff is doing everything to assist the guests in every field.The rooms are expensive and so are the services provided by the hotel but they worth any penny.

We stayed in the Cerulean for 5 nights in April. Travelling with our 2 year old meant that we were looking for a hotel with a good handy location for sightseeing and also reasonable size rooms - both of these requirements the Cerulean definitely lives up to. It’s a short stroll to the Shibuya train station, scramble crossing and also numerous eatery options. With a trundle bed (at extra cost) and two suitcases our room still feels spacious enough to be comfortable for the five nights. The staff have all been so friendly and accommodating, the bed is extremely comfortable and the complimentary water bottles replenished each day have been gratefully received. It’s a shame we’re staying in such a nice hotel because we’re actually spending such little time in the room because of all the things there are to see and do in Tokyo, but it’s been a lovely oasis to return to after a busy day.

On our last night in Tokyo we transfered to this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the staff are very friendly. The room we got is on the 24rth floor facing Mt.Fuji, everything is wonderful. Love the huge bedroom and bathroom. Location is truly wonderful! Definitely worth it!

We stayed here on the last leg of our stay in Japan and it was to be the highlight of our stay. We splurged on this hotel and it was worth every penny. It is relatively close to Shibuya metro train making it very easy to travel around Tokyo. However, we did seem to get lost every time we tried to get from the station to the hotel. This was however a common theme for us exiting any train or metro station in Japan.The room had a city view which was spectacular. There is a bar at the top of the hotel which was fine but if you want a view then either reserve a table at the bar or upgrade your room type.The room has a free mobile phone for guests which is absolutely amazing because we used it for google maps and for making calls home.It was a brilliant way to end our stay. I would definitely stay here again if I am lucky enough to go back to Japan.

We stayed here a full week during our visit to Tokyo. Highlights: (1) clean hotel with great views, we even managed to see Mt. Fuji our 1st day, (2) wonderful concierge that will make Michelin star restaurant reservations for you, (3) there is a built in 7-Eleven (in Japan 7-Elevens are amazing) on the 2nd floor that is super convenient and 24/7, (4) it is a 5-10 minute walk from Shibuya Station, and lastly (5) the neighborhood just south of the hotel is a hidden gem...its great to walk around the area if you want to feel slightly less urban. Everyone speaks English too if you are not comfortable with speaking some Japanese.

Outstanding 5-Star hotel, towering over the Shubuya crossing made famous in Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift film. Occupying a city block, the hotel is a massive and iconic polished pink granite tower in the Tokyo skyline.Cerulean Tower is arguably the largest, most elegant, yet functionally comfortable in all of Japan. Cerulean Tower is at once a towering edifice yet brilliantly sublime in functional arrangement, use, comfort and Japanese hospitality.The property is extremely well situated in Tokyo, occupying a central position and city block in Shibuya, with a short walk to trains, restaurants, shopping, and a variety of great Tokyo venues and locations. Massive and modern, yet still comfortable with tradtional Japanese elements smartly used in the exquisite lobby and guest rooms. Guest staying in the Execitve Floors have access to one of the nicest Executive lounges in Asia. Great views of Mount Fuji over the City of Tokyo, with exceptional service and food offerings. Top rating for this extremely fine hotel that is a one-of-a-kind hotel experience. A grand urban hotel.

service was good and very helpful. I do not remember the name of the lady in charge. I asked several items in relation to arrangements for meals and sites which I do not know. Even though she was very busy, she was happy to help me with full smile on her face. I was relieved and grateful. And I will recommend this hotel to my friends due to her excellent service and attitude.

We booked the Cerulean tower Tokyo hotel because it was our first time in Tokyo and wanted a spacious room to base ourselves, in case the business of Tokyo became to muchAs it happened we loved Tokyo and could have saved money by using a moderate and smaller room/hotel. Having said that the cerulean was a great base. We had a really good deal for a superior king room. Not sure we would pay more to stay here again, but if we could match our deal we would certainly use this hotel again as a base. Our room was large. Small entrance lobby, a small walk in wardrobe area. Large main room with oversized bed, table chairs and large tv. The room felt bigger due to the expansive views from the 25 floor over toward the sky tree and Tokyo tower and from the huge en-suite bathroom you could see Shinjuku from the bath. The hotel had some lovely facilities, which we didn’t use, except for their own 7/11 where we bought breakfast and coffee and sat at the table in our room enjoying the views. The staff here were exceptionally helpful, but overall our experience of Tokyo was friendly and helpful, so no change there. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Tokyo

Hotel is located in Shibuya, a very vibrant area. It's about 6-8 mins walk to Shibuya station, which is quite convenient. Getting there from the airport is a breeze as there is an airport shuttle that stops right at the hotel. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very spacious by Japanese standards. The toilet also comes with a bath tub. An interesting benefit is the room comes with a smartphone that has an internet connection and that can make international calls, all free. Overall this is a very good hotel to stay in

We stayed 5 nights in this hotel in the heart of Shibuya. It's an easy 7-minute walk to Shibuya station and a 5 minute walk to the winding streets packed with restaurants and bars that make Shibuya a place known for nightlife. I wish we could have stayed longer!The staff are knowledgeable, friendly, polite, and generous with their time and information. The hotel is extremely clean and we found the room to be very spacious by Japanese standards. Gorgeous views of Tokyo from the higher floors, and depending on location, you might be able to see the Sky Tree, Tokyo Tower, and the Government buildings. An extra bonus is that this hotel provides you with a wireless hotspot to take with you during your stay (don't forget to return it when you check out) which could have reduced our costs as we bought one for our stay from JapanWireless.

Great Shibuya location. Service is off the charts. The gym and spa are the best we've seen in Japan. If you're staying on the executive floors, the Western-style breakfast and the afternoon happy hour on the 35th floor are amazing. You will not be disappointed. The rooms are excellent. The two bars on the 40th floor have stunning views. If you can afford this hotel, you should stay here. No complaints at all about the Cerulean. We'll do this one again next time we're in Tokyo.

My husband and I were only in Tokyo for one night, however we had a wonderful experience and one of the biggest factors in that was the quality of our stay at the Cerulean Tower. Upon arriving at the Shibuya train station, the hotel was a quick and easy walk away (very easy to find - especially with looking at the photo of the hotel). The staff was so friendly and helpful with all of our needs. The hotel is beautiful and our room was perfect - comfortable with a great view and all of the amenities we needed. The location is fantastic in that you are a short walk from Shibuya crossing, a ton of the stores/cafes/bars/malls/great food, Harajuku. When we had to leave the next morning we were able to walk downstairs to the 7eleven right at the bottom of the building to grab delicious snacks and get yen from the ATM for the airport shuttle service provided by the hotel (they have taxi and shuttle to both Tokyo airports for a very reasonable price). We obviously would have loved to explore more of the features of the hotel (dining, jazz club) but could not due to our short stay. Would definitely recommend!!!

We loved everything about this hotel except for the price of the food and drink. 3100yen (~$31) for breakfast is ridiculous. Over $40 for a burger or fried chicken dinner. $11 for a coffee!! Come on! A family of four spends as much as the nightly room rate for a meal! I expected more even price equities from this international iPrefer Hotel. Your scale is way off.

We stayed at the Cerulean Hotel as a family of two adults and two school age children. We chose the Cerulean based on prior positive experiences and because they offered a “Family Suite” on many major booking websites. The Family Suite consists of two connected regular King bed rooms, so you essentially get two normal hotel rooms for your family. Considering how expensive hotels can be in Tokyo, the Family Suite setup represented a really good value for a luxury hotel in a great location.The Cerulean is located inside a high-rise office tower. It is an easy 5-10 minute walk from Shibuya station and the famous Shibuya scramble crossing. The walk requires crossing a busy street and highway using a pedestrian overpass, so it could be challenging with a lot of luggage or if you aren’t good with stairs. The Airport Limousine stops at this hotel, so access from either Narita or Haneda airport is very easy. Even though the Cerulean is in the heart of Shibuya, it was a very quiet property and provides a nice respite from the noise outside.Our hotel room was great. It was spacious by Japanese standards, and the bathroom is simply fantastic. There’s a nice shower as well as a separate bathtub, both with great water pressure and nice hot temperatures. There’s also a huge spread of bath amenities. Because it’s a high rise, there are great views of Tokyo on a clear day, and the city lights are stunning at night. You get a sense for how immense Tokyo is. One nice touch is that a mobile phone is provided in the room. It’s nice to have a local telephone number to make dinner reservations and the like.We did not eat in any of the restaurants at the Cerulean because there are simply so many options steps away. We did however find the 7-11 convenience store in the building to be very useful to purchase a variety of food and snacks.We’d definitely stay at the Cerulean again. It’s perfect for the tourist family who desires an upscale modern hotel in Tokyo.

Cerulean Tower Tokyo Hotel is an oasis in the heart of Shibuya, tucked nicely between the hustle of Shibuya station and the idyllic neighborhood of Daikanyama. It is my "go to" hotel after traveling to Tokyo for work 8 times in the last year. It is the rare hotel which caters perfectly for both serious business trips as well as family vacations. It does not disappoint in the impeccable service of its highly trained staff to the elegance of its restaurants and can't miss hotel bar (Bellevisto) from the top bar. On the latter, Park the bartender is truly an artist of cocktails and one of the best bartenders in the city. Their concierge service (especially Nauko) has been exceptional as well.The rooms are large and full of classic Western hotel amenities. The views from the room are simply majestic and like having a window from Instagram. Every faucet and detail is managed in 5 star manner by the incredible staff. Cerulean offers this 5 star experience with extremely reasonable rates which sets itself far apart from its peers whose nose bleeding pricing only makes it available to "travel expense budgets". Cerulean is in a class of its own as best luxury hotel in Tokyo based on price, versatility (business and personal), location, amenities and staff.

Overall, this is an amazing hotel. A little on the pricey side, but it is definitely worth it. We were upgraded, same room size, but better view.Room size: huge for Japanese hotel.Bed/pillow: very comfortable bed and pillow. Super king size bed (which I believe is made up of 2 double bed). There was a tear on the sheet, and was changed immediately when we informed the staff.Lighting: well lit.Cleanliness: very cleanToilet/bathroom: huge. Separate bath, shower, toilet and sink. A chair was provided too. City view in the bathtub area.Toiletries: good products. Bath salt was provided too and also facial toiletries.Aircon/heater: non centralised which is great as we can adjust the temperature to our liking. PowerPoints: sufficient and we have our power board.Staff attitude: very polite and helpful. Proximity to station/amenities: very close to Shibuya streets (lots of food and shopping). About 10minutes walk to station. Family Mart and 7-11 nearby.View: great city view Breakfast: our room rate did not include breakfast but works fine for us as we like to eat out when we are in Tokyo.Others inclusions (slippers, etc): slipper included as you would expect. Separate wardrobe area and plenty of storage.

The room we got was very spacious! With big literally walk in cabinet, bathroom was spacious as well with Bath tub that can look out at the city skyline. Room is clean and well maintained. There was kids toiletries provided as well.Was abit disappointed that we didn't get a room that can get a glimpse of Mt Fuji. Another real disappointing part was that the tea bags were chargeable. In all the hotels I stayed in, only this hotel charge for usage of tea, which I find is very petty and stingy of the management. A 5 star hotel should do better than that. Location is good, near to wonderful eating places and shopping areas and very near JR shibuya station.

From all of the research I did, it really seemed like Shibuya or Shinjuku were the two best areas to stay for a first time visit to Japan. We settled on the Cerulean in Shibuya because the reviews were really great and the price was very reasonable for a high end hotel in Tokyo with incredible skyline views which was very important to me (the Hyatt in Shinjuku was just too expensive for us to swallow and this seemed like a great second choice at a lower price point). The beds at the Cerulean were comfy which was really important for me because my back was very sore after the long-haul flight from Toronto. This is a true 4 star hotel with lots of nice little luxury touches, but it is not a '5 star' hotel by any means. We had a room on one of the upgraded floors, which was great and spotlessly clean. The view of the city from our room was awesome and we even had an incredible view of the city below us from the bathroom right over the bath which was very cool! The breakfast buffet was excellent and had something to suit all tastes, including 'classic' North American and European breakfast options. The only issue was that my husband and I felt nauseous while we were staying at this hotel, which, it is important to note, was for the first three nights of our trip. That being said, we were extremely jet lagged because we started our trip in Tokyo and it took us a while to adjust to the time change so we always felt kind of groggy and gross the first few days whenever we were in our hotel room. My husband thought that maybe we felt nauseous because our room in the hotel was really high up since the hotel is on the upper levels of a super high-rise building, and that we were feeling nauseous from feeling the towers sway very subtly in the wind. However, I really do think it was the jet lag that was the culprit.TIPS: DIRECTIONS FROM HANEDA AIRPORT TO THE HOTEL -Online it said it was approximately one hour to get to the hotel from the airport but we arrived during rush hour and it took us nearly two hours to get to the hotel by bus from Haneda Airport, so plan accordingly in terms of timing because it was a long bus ride for sure.Option 1 – Hotel Limousine Bus (approx. 60 minutes) Buy ticket from information desk - Keikyu Bus Touchscreen ticket machinesCost: 1030 yen per personTicket: Bus departure customers from Haneda Airport International Terminal should purchase ticket first from the Bus Ticketing Counter on the 2nd floor or the Bus Ticket Machine in the Ground floor. Bus stop shown in Orange is the bus stop for Airport Limousine Bus.Boarding: See map below (orange little bus is where to board from the international passenger terminal at Haneda Airport):Option 2 – Subway (approx. 60 minutes)Purchase a Suica card at the airport and load up Suica card, cost is about JPY 580 to get to the hotel.Directions:(1) Haneda Airport International Terminal / Haneda Airport Domestic Terminal Keikyu Airport Line (approximately 14 - 25 minutes )(2) Shinagawa Station JR Yamanote Line (approximately 12 minutes )(3) Shibuya Station on foot, 5 minutes.(4) Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel

Most of Tokyo’s luxury hotels are in and around Ginza and the downtown area, but if you want similar accommodations in Shibuya this is a great option. It’s 5 minutes from the famous crossing and Dogenzaka, and there’s lots of good food downstairs. Also has a great rooftop bar, though it would be nice if they had some better cocktail options. Only downside is that everything you can buy is hilariously expensive. I think an oolong tea at the cafe was like 1100Y. Yikes. Maybe skip on the extras.

Travelling with a 1-year-old, space and convenience are our priority. This hotel delivers on that. We booked the Supreme King and were given the Corner King. The room is huge (even the room we originally booked), which means there is space for a baby cot and still lots of walking and luggage space in the room. Being steps away from Shibuya Station, we could eat and get anything we wanted very easily. The airport limousine bus stops here as well. So if you are traveling with babies, this really is a top choice.

I have been in this hotel for 2 nights due to a business trip.The position is super convenient since in 5 min walk you reach Shibuya-Ku station, in the heart of Tokyo.The Area here the hotel is located is full of restaurants, convenience stores open 24h.All the staff is extremely polite and always available for any need.The rooms are very clean, silent,big and equipped with everything you need ( an iron board and machine, set to clean shoes and coat, air dryer, Bose wireless system and also a handy that can be used as personal hotspot!)The bath set is very qualitative!( from L’Occitane). Last but not least the hotel has a bar on 40th floor with an amazing view of the city!I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone that want to make their stay unforgettable in Tokyo!

Husband and I stayed here recently...was the perfect experience...great views from out junior suite room in the executive floor and the bar was amazing with night views of tokyo like something from a movie...if we visit Japan again will definitely be coming back

Just a 5 minute walk from the Shibuya multi - crossing and main shopping area. Across a footbridge for all the bars and restaurants in Shibuya. Great location. Large beds , large rooms and bathrooms. Small point but my room was difficult to keep cool even in March and with an additional AC unit. Good breakfast buffet with made to order Omelet station - catering for all nationalities- but very Western friendly. Try to get the breakfast included with your room price - otherwise you will be charged ¥3200 - around $30. There is a Starbucks on Shibuya crossing if you are in need of a Corporate coffee fix. One of the real advantages of this hotel is the gym. 4 treadmills, 3 bikes, a couple of cross trainers and a good weights area. Opens at 6am and gets busy from opening - but very good to have. Also an excellent pool. Overall great service , very good location and leisure facilities makes this the place to stay in Shibuya.

For US travelers this will be a welcome visit. Large rooms huge bathrooms. Not a typical Japanese experience so if you want that small room local vibe this is not it. Great location to all sorts of entertainment

This hotel is situated real close to Shibuya crossing. The room was modern, good sized, and has the complete amenities. The view from the room was spectacular. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here once again in the future.

We booked for 5 nights as a comfortable base for the marathon. Wow how lucky were we, Superior King Room is so spacious, and everything you would expect. Check in staff on arrival were extremely helpful and friendly, as it was 9am they offered us a room to shower and freshen up as check in opens at 14:00pm. So we dropped our bags with the concierge and headed out for the day. Overall experience has been great, with the exception of the very confusing TV set up (gave up) and a minor unfortunate staffing issue in the dinning room on our second visit in the restaurant, we were ignored by one of the waiters on water duty, when the previous visit he was superb, and the next he blanked us but continued to provide his service to every guest around us. As I say minor issue but it was frustrating to be blatantly ignored and not acceptable.

it was the first time my family traveled to Japan, we landed at Haneda airport, looked for bus ticket booth, buy tickets, went down to bus stop, bus took us to lower ground of Cerulean hotel, it was very convenient for us first time travelers to Japan. the hotel is a bit pricey but very convenient, clean, courteous, room was big, window view of Mount Fuji, water pressure was strong, etc

This hotel itself is everything you’d expect from a luxury hotel. We had a mid-level room and it was very spacious, with a sitting area, desk, and very nice bathroom. We got room service one night and it was decent (we ordered American food, hamburgers and salads). Overall we were completely satisfied with the service and the room. They have a shuttle service for fairly cheap that we used to get to the airport, and it was super easy and got us there right on time. You will see the time chart of the shuttle buses in your welcome papers, and you can just reserve at the concierge. The buffet breakfast was good. Although I wouldn’t put that in the amazing category, it was good enough to take advantage of the convenience and eat there each morning. They have fresh squeeze orange juice, fruits, and an assortment of both American and Japanese standard breakfast items. The one thing I would say is overall in the amazing category is their pastries. Their croissants and other pastries are made at the hotel, and kudos to them, they are as good as ones in France (they have a bakery counter if you just want to buy a coffee and croissant, right at the restaurant entry). The best thing about this hotel is the location. It’s less than 5 minutes to walkto Shibuya Crossing and Metro station. Very well located if you are into walking and exploring. If I had to find nitpicky things I wish were different for this hotel, I wish they had a spa (most people won’t care though I’m sure). Also, they did not have a large selection of TV stations, and no english stations. Only local stations. But neither of those dampened my opinion too much. This hotel made our stay in Tokyo very pleasant, and I would definitely recommend staying here. We were able to walk around and use the Metro to get everywhere. We also took a day tour to Mt. Fuji that was able to pick us up at the hotel. So no car needed.

The hotel offers very good service for the moment we arrived. The room is a good size for japan and addition of the walk in wardrobe is great. We booked a corner room which was really good choice. All the rooms are on the higher floor already but next time I would choose to stay on the west side so I can see city and Bay view. The room is quiet, well appointed and the bed is large and comfortable. The location to train station, shops and restaurants is excellent. There is also a convenient store just right across the road that is very handy. The airport transfer bus service works very well with no extra charge. I actually told them that it was our anniversary and they offered us a warm welcome box of chocolate, although I thought that a bottle of sparkling would be more surprise touch. Now the cons: at this price complementary coffee and tea should come with the room. There is no place to hang towel which is a little inconvenient. The TV has no international channel eg BBC, CNN or food channel which I always love to watch when i am on holidays or I could not find it! I would definitely stay there again..

Stayed here in Feb, 2019. A warm and very central hotel in Shibuya. Lots of things to see and do within an easy walk of the hotel.There is a very good bar and restaurant at the top of hotel with panoramic views overlooking Tokyo. Good for a nightcap. The rooms are large and can easily fit all your luggage. Free WiFi and a wide arrange of restaurants within the hotel.

We stayed with 3 of our 6 children aged 7-17 all experienced travelers. We were shocked to be literally denied entrance to 3 of the hotels 4 restaurants upon arrival ( not counting the breakfast buffet area) and were told no children under 18 despite our daughter (7) fully dressed and perfectly capable of a dinner. The Japanese restaurant offered we could ‘ pay for a private dining room’. Seriously? To hide our perfectly functional sushi loving daughter? The 4th restaurant was ‘ full’ and we were given directions to a 10 min walk to a lesser restaurant. Then, the next day, we tried to use the pool as this same child is a swimmer and wanted to practice for an upcoming meet. Again sorry, no entrance, not 18 and the bellman literally said ‘kids are too dirty’ for pool. I presume they are thinking of diapered babies, not my racing 7 year old. I spoke to management twice looking for help or some adjustments. They were completely incapable. We travel plenty. I’ve never had this happen. We paid for 2 rooms to house 5 of us and couldn’t use the facilities. For business travel or for couples go for it. Do not come here with anyone under 18. Period.

We stayed as a family of 3 adults and 1 baby in 1 room and everything was well thoughtout and prepared for us. There were 4 complete sets of towels and 3 beds with 2 pillows each.Additionally, as Japan is well known for its level of service, it was even more exceptional that this hotel managed to stand out well above the average. Our son was ill and the amazing concierge staff walked us over to the nearby clinic and translated to the clinic staff to help us be seen by the doctor.We can't say enough good things about this hotel and we definitely would stay again on our next visit.

Nice hotelGood serviceBreakfast excluded The breakfast is very delicious the staff were okIf need massage for aching neckHotel can arrange from outside send to room 45 mins around 70 SGDGood location All shopping centers is walking distance

The Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel is located just behind the scramble crossing at Shibuya station. Location wise it is fantastic, as you are close to the action, but on a slightly more quiet street. The rooms are very nicely appointed with magnificent views over Tokyo. My room looked directly towards Mt Fuji. Wonderful to wake up in the morning and gaze out at Fuji from bed. The bed was so comfortable - one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. After a long flight this hotel is amazing for a big sleep!The fitness facilities are great too if you want some down time. They are equipped with a gym, sauna, spa and pool.The staff were lovely too.Overall I was very pleasantly surprised by the standards of this hotel. It was truly 5-star, and I would recommend it to anyone staying in Tokyo.
